intro: Crotalaria seretii, commonly known as the African crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with distinctive spurred petals, which are characteristic of the Crotalaria genus. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately compound, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. Crotalaria seretii is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
